### clean pols_month_df data
```{r}
pols_month_df = 
  read_csv("fivethirtyeight_datasets/pols-month.csv", 
           na = c("NA", ".", "")) |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  
  # break up the month-year-day variable
  tidyr::separate(mon, into = c("year", "month", "day"),
                  sep = "-", convert = TRUE) |>
  mutate(
    
    # replace month number with month name
    month = month.name[month],
    month = factor(month, levels = month.name, ordered = TRUE),
    
    # create a president variable, taking values gop and dem
    president = if_else(prez_gop == 1, "gop", "dem")) |>
  
  # remove prez_dem and prez_gop and the day variable
  select(-prez_gop, -prez_dem, -day)

print(pols_month_df, n = 10)
```

### clean snp data
```{r} 
snp_df = 
  read_csv("fivethirtyeight_datasets/snp.csv", 
           na = c("NA", ".", "")) |>
  janitor::clean_names() |>
  
  # Convert to year-month-day
  mutate(date = mdy(date)) |>
  
  # Arrange according to year and month,
  mutate(
    year  = year(date),
    month = month(date),
    month = month.name[month],
    month = factor(month, levels = month.name, ordered = TRUE),
    day   = mday(date)
  ) |>
  
  # Year and month are the leading columns
  select(year, month, day, close) |>
  arrange(year, month)

print(snp_df, n = 10)

```
